messages.message:
I'm getting this ruby gem installer error in the build job for this backport PR: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/7293211459/job/19901470988?pr=51417

does anyone know how to resolve it:
```Run gem install bundler
ERROR:  Error installing bundler:
	The last version of bundler (>= 0) to support your Ruby & RubyGems was 2.4.22. Try installing it with `gem install bundler -v 2.4.22`
	bundler requires Ruby version >= 3.0.0. The current ruby version is 2.6.10.210.
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.```

Is that on 23.10-enterprise? If so try pulling and rebasing on the latest, should be fixed

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C035SLYCJ9X/p1703055069147719 (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C035SLYCJ9X/p1703055069147719)
ah its 23.07 but I assume the fix is the same. Thanks!
hm it seems up to date with release-23.07 branch so I don't think thats it
@Cody Boggs we probably want this backported to all the branches?

:man-shrugging:  wasn’t my change so I didn’t want to be overly presumptuous. Lol
I didn’t see reports of older releases breaking so I kept scope limited. Can backport after lunch
We're seeing this all the way back to 22.10 backports PRs as well

@Heymian @jtau
If one of y'all would be so kind as to approve:
22.10: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/51455
23.01: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/51459
23.04: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/51457
23.07: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/51458
@Udit if you rebase again it should pass
